checkForOneSolution

public boolean checkForOneSolution(int r,
                                   int c,
                                   int[][] boardCopy)
This method should check every possible combination of numbers to see if its a valid solution. It should finally return true when the first blank number it checked runs out of numbers to check.

Parameters:
r - current row
c - current column
boardCopy - the numbers remaining in a sudoku grid

createBoard

public void createBoard()
Sudoku creation will be done in the order of these steps: 1. Assign values to each cell in the grid. 2. Set the images to each cell. 3. Remove images in groups, ensuring that the puzzle only has one solution 4. Puzzle is completed once 20-30 clues / images remain

createCells

public void createCells()

getBlankSquare

public static greenfoot.GreenfootImage getBlankSquare()

getImageNumber

public static greenfoot.GreenfootImage getImageNumber(int number)

removeNums

public boolean removeNums()
Converts to a matrix of integers first. Then removes a specific group of numbers based on the clue count. It checks that the removed numbers leave one unique solution. If it does, it also removes this from the board. If it doesn't work, it recreates the integer matrix and trys again.

saveWorldAsImage

public void saveWorldAsImage()
Saves an image of the generated Sudoku to the same folder as the greenfoot project.

setNums

public boolean setNums(int r,
                       int c)
Sets a blank grid of cells to numbers that follow sudoku rules using recursion.

Parameters:
r - current row
c - current column
